```{r import}
library(tidyverse)
library(modelr)
```

```{r fundamentals, include=FALSE}


# Load fundamental data
fundamentals <- read_csv("fundamentals.csv")

# Select only necessary variables
fundamentals <- select(
  fundamentals,
  `Ticker Symbol`,
  `For Year`,
  `Total Assets`,
  `Intangible Assets`,
  `Liabilities`,
  `Earnings Per Share`,
  `Total Revenue`,
  `Current Ratio`,
  `Quick Ratio`,
  `Profit Margin`,
  `Operating Margin`,
  `Total Liabilities`,
  `Total Equity`,
  `Retained Earnings`,
  `Gross Margin`,
  `Estimated Shares Outstanding`
  )

# Filter invalid data
fundamentals_2015 <- filter(
  fundamentals,
  `For Year` != 1215,
  `For Year` < 2016
  )

# Mutate the data to get a new predictors
fundamentals_2015 <- mutate(fundamentals_2015,
  `Book Value` = `Total Assets` - (`Intangible Assets` + `Liabilities`),
  `Asset Turnover` = `Total Revenue` / `Total Assets`,
  `Total Debt To Equity` = `Total Liabilities` / `Total Equity`
)

```

```{r prices}
# Load prices data
prices <- read_csv("prices.csv")

# Find the average prices
prices_per_year <- prices %>%
  mutate(date = as.numeric(format(date, "%Y"))) %>%
  group_by(date, symbol) %>%
  summarise(avg_open = mean(open, na.rm=TRUE), avg_close = mean(close, na.rm=TRUE))
```

```{r fundamental_and_prices}
# Left join with prices
fundamental_and_prices <- fundamentals_2015 %>%
  left_join(prices_per_year, by=c("For Year"="date", "Ticker Symbol"="symbol"))

# Creae
fit <- lm(avg_close ~ `Book Value` +
`Earnings Per Share` +
`Total Revenue` +
`Current Ratio` +
`Quick Ratio` +
`Profit Margin` +
`Operating Margin` +
`Asset Turnover` +
`Total Debt To Equity` +
`Retained Earnings` +
`Gross Margin`, data = fundamental_and_prices, na.action=na.omit)

summary(fit)

# Filter the PR value that is more than 0.05 (5%)

fit2 <- lm(avg_close ~ `Book Value` +
`Earnings Per Share` +
`Profit Margin` +
`Operating Margin` +
`Total Debt To Equity`, data = fundamental_and_prices, na.action=na.omit)

summary(fit2)

kfoldCv <- function(formula, data, folds = 0) {
  # Error handling
  if(!inherits(formula, "formula")) {
    stop("Not a formula")
  }
  
  # Convert to tibble
  data <- as.tibble(data)
  set.seed(1)
  
  message("Partitioning the data")
  data_cv <- crossv_kfold(data, folds)
  
  message("Fitting models for cross-validation on training sets")
  data_cv <- data_cv %>%
    mutate(fit  = map(train, ~ lm(formula, data = ., na.action=na.omit)))
  
  message("Getting the cross-validated prediction errors")
  data_cv <- data_cv %>%
    mutate(rmse_train = map2_dbl(fit, train, ~ rmse(.x, .y)),
    rmse_test = map2_dbl(fit, test, ~ rmse(.x, .y)))
  
  mean(data_cv$rmse_test)
}

model1 <- kfoldCv(
  avg_close ~ `Book Value` +
  `Earnings Per Share` +
  `Total Revenue` +
  `Current Ratio` +
  `Quick Ratio` +
  `Profit Margin` +
  `Operating Margin` +
  `Asset Turnover` +
  `Total Debt To Equity` +
  `Retained Earnings` +
  `Gross Margin`,
  fundamental_and_prices,
  folds = 10
  )
model2 <- kfoldCv(
  avg_close ~ `Book Value` +
  `Earnings Per Share` +
  `Profit Margin` +
  `Operating Margin` +
  `Total Debt To Equity`,
  fundamental_and_prices,
  folds = 10
  )
```
